citing_paper_authors: Matteo, Negri | Luisa, Bentivogli | Yashar, Mehdad | Danilo, Giampiccolo | Alessandro, Marchetti
raw_text: Crowdsourcing services, such as Amazon Mechanical Turk6 (MTurk) and CrowdFlower7, have been recently used with success for a variety of NLPapplications (Callison-Burch and Dredze, 2010)
clean_text: Crowdsourcing services, such as Amazon Mechanical Turk (MTurk) and CrowdFlower, have been recently used with success for a variety of NLP applications (Callison-Burch and Dredze, 2010).

citing_paper_authors: Sumit, Basu | Lee, Becker | Lucy, Vanderwende
raw_text: Cor pus creation using AMT has numerous precedents now; see i.e. Callison-Burch and Dredze (2010) and Heilman and Smith (2010b)
clean_text: Corpus creation using AMT has numerous precedents now; see i.e. Callison-Burch and Dredze (2010) and Heilman and Smith (2010b).

citing_paper_authors: John D., Burger | John C., Henderson | George, Kim | Guido, Zarrella
raw_text: A number of researcher shave recently experimented with the use of Amazon Mechanical Turk (AMT) to create and evaluate human language data (Callison-Burch and Dredze, 2010)
clean_text: A number of researchers have recently experimented with the use of Amazon Mechanical Turk (AMT) to create and evaluate human language data (Callison-Burch and Dredze, 2010).

raw_text: Over the last several of years, Mechanical Turk, introduced by Amazon as? artificial artificial intelligence?, has been used successfully for a number of NLP tasks, including robust evaluation of machine translation systems by reading comprehension (Callison-Burch, 2009), and other tasks explored in the recent NAACL workshop (Callison-Burch and Dredze, 2010b)
clean_text: Over the last several of years, Mechanical Turk, introduced by Amazon as artificial artificial intelligence, has been used successfully for a number of NLP tasks, including robust evaluation of machine translation systems by reading comprehension (Callison-Burch, 2009), and other tasks explored in the recent NAACL workshop (Callison-Burch and Dredze, 2010b).

raw_text: A number of mechanisms for quality control have been proposed for use with Mechanical Turk annotation (Callison-Burch and Dredze, 2010a)
clean_text: A number of mechanisms for quality control have been proposed for use with Mechanical Turk annotation (Callison-Burch and Dredze, 2010a).

raw_text: That paper appeared in a NAACL 2010 workshop organized by Callison-Burch and Dredze (2010) ,focusing on MTurk as a source of data for speech and language tasks
clean_text: That paper appeared in a NAACL 2010 workshop organized by Callison-Burch and Dredze (2010), focusing on MTurk as a source of data for speech and language tasks.

citing_paper_authors: Jacob, Devlin | Erika, Malchiodi | Rabih, Zbib | David G., Stallard | Richard M., Schwartz | Spyros, Matsoukas | John, Makhoul | Omar F., Zaidan | Chris, Callison-Burch
raw_text: Callison-Burch and Dredze (2010) provide an overview of various tasks for which MTurk has been used, and offer a set of best practices for ensuring high-quality data
clean_text: Callison-Burch and Dredze (2010) provide an overview of various tasks for which MTurk has been used, and offer a set of best practices for ensuring high-quality data.
